definition: Temple of Earth (in Beijing)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
platform/rostrum/altar

sentences.english: Yesterday afternoon, reporters asked the hospital to call the matter to the altar.
sentences.chinese: 昨天下午，記者致電地壇醫院詢問此事。

sentences.english: Excuse me, can you tell me how far it is from Xidan to Ditan park?
sentences.chinese: 請問，你能告訴我從西單到地壇公園有多遠嗎？
地壇醫院的代理人反覆強調。

sentences.english: Besides the altar, the attraction of the park also lies in its quietness.
sentences.chinese: 除了地壇，公園的魅力還在於它的靜。

sentences.english: Sounds interesting! What interesting places are there in The Ditan temple fair?
sentences.chinese: 聽起來很有意思，地壇廟會有什麼好玩的？

sentences.english: But, talking about Ditan Park, there are not so many people who know it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，說起地壇公園，就沒有那麼多的人去過了。

sentences.english: After the event, Ditan hospitals require hospitalization Ming month.
sentences.chinese: 事情發生後，地壇醫院要求張明住院治療一個月。

definition: lobby/foyer/CL:間|间[jian1]
(coll.) a moment/a while
area above the lintel of a doorway
Yongdingmen, front gate of the outer section of Beijing's old city wall, torn down in the 1950s and reconstructed in 2005
Old town district/Gucheng district of Lijiang city 麗江市|丽江市[Li4 jiang1 shi4], Yunnan
altar lamp burning day and night
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
Long Xing Quan - "Dragon Fist" - Martial Art
Fuchengmen neighborhood of Beijing
Longevity Hill in the Summer Palace 頤和園|颐和园[Yi2 he2 yuan2], Beijing
Linggu temple (Nanjing)
easel/rack for painting
Great stone bridge or Dashiqiao county level city in Yingkou 營口|营口, Liaoning
to be an eyesore/(fig.) to spoil the fun/to be a wet blanket
higher authority/the bosses/on top of
porter for a palanquin
